Dear Diane Marquess:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 10/18/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (2) The personnel record must contain all the
following information before employment may
occur:
• (e) A record of any convictions other than
minor traffic violations from either of the
following:
• (i) The Michigan state police, tribal
police, or the equivalent state or
Canadian provincial law
enforcement agency where the
person usually resides.
Two of Fourteen personnel files reviewed contained the required 3 references
obtained after the staff member was hired.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
• (2) An agency social service worker shall visit
the foster child, and the foster parent, if

applicable, in the child's placement at least once
every month.
One of Eight open files of youths in foster care placements did not contain
documentation that face-to-face visits with the youth and caregiver were
completed as required as one calendar month visit was missed.
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
• (2) The agreement must be signed and dated by
the youth and the social service worker. The
agreement must be reviewed with the youth at
least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
Three of Eight open files of youths in independent living placements did not
contain independent living contracts updated and signed every 90 days.
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
• (1) An agency social service worker shall
complete a written adoptive evaluation within 90
days of the family signing an adoption
application and prior to approving a family for
adoption.
One of Six adoptive family assessments reviewed was not completed within 90
days of the signed application.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
11/06/2023 Interim, CAP approved 11/22/2023
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Service plan development with all participating parties must be clearly
documented in the case record within case contacts, Family Team Meeting
reports, and/or Parent Agency Treatment Plan check boxes and signatures.
• Home visits every calendar month must include both the youth and foster
parent present for the same visit.
• The licensing rule use of "service plans" includes the requirements of both the
Case Service Plan and Parent Agency Treatment plan templates. Since the
licensing rules require the service plans be signed by the worker and

supervisor, make sure both the Case Service Plan and Parent Agency
Treatment plans are signed and uploaded into the case record.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided regarding the Chief Administrator and Licensee
Designee assignment now that CAPs must be completed within CWLM.
• Case contacts should clearly document who was present and include
narrative to support quality visits are occurring as opposed to simply
documenting the visit took place and documents were signed. Case contacts
are a good way to document the quality of work being done with families.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was 1 substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. The one special evaluation report involving a foster parent's placement on
central registry was not reviewed during this inspection as it was reviewed during SI#
2024SIC0001511 date 9/19/2024 for which a CAP was required but has not yet been
approved.
There was 1 incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. The one special evaluation report in which corporal punishment was
established was not reviewed during this inspection as it was reviewed during SI#
2024SIC0001511 date 9/19/2024 for which a CAP was required but has not yet been
approved.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The one
CAP submitted by the agency was in response to the 2023 licensing inspection
report dated 11/6/2023 and was approved on 11/22/23. That CAP addressed 12
violations only one of which was repeated during this inspection. That violation
was related to adoptive family timeliness and was cited in one file.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator identified issues with compliance due to staffing turnover;
however, increased training supports, and compliance monitoring tools have been
implemented, which has improved overall compliance.
Financial Overview
An annual financial audit was reviewed. No financial concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
Staff members reported receiving adequate support and assistance from
management. They reported utilizing tracking forms implemented after the last

inspection, which they find helpful in remaining compliant with required forms and
reports.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space and equipment to provide the delivery of foster
care, independent living, and certification services. Physical CHRI is stored
securely, and a cross shredder is located next to the physical CHRI. All other files
are stored securely in a file storage room. Closed adoption files are stored in a
separate locked room to prevent unauthorized access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
No Safety Concerns identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
